meanings.definition: To schedule for a different time or date.
meanings.sent1: I rescheduled our meeting for tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She rescheduled her dentist appointment for next week.
meanings.sent3: The party was rescheduled due to bad weather.
meanings.sent4: The concert was rescheduled, causing disappointment among fans.
meanings.sent5: He rescheduled his flight to avoid missing the conference.

meanings.sent1: After the cancellation, they rescheduled the event quickly.
meanings.sent2: They rescheduled the project timeline to accommodate the changes.
meanings.sent3: The rescheduled picnic turned out to be even more fun than before.
meanings.sent4: She rescheduled her priorities to focus on her health.
meanings.sent5: The rescheduled meeting gave them a chance to rethink their strategy.
